title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 07 August 2014 - XWiki
content:
<Denis> has joined #xwiki  
00:16 <Denis> has quit  
00:44 <abusenius\_> has quit  
06:46 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
06:53 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:03 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
07:56 <tillo> has joined #xwiki  
08:12 <vfzevaze> has joined #xwiki  
08:18 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:20 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
08:32 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:47 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
08:57 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
09:16 <vfzevaze> Hi there! How to create validations using regular expressions? Is this ( http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Creating+a+form+with+validation+and+tooltips ) still up to date with xwiki601? I just added the expression to the class ( http://i.imgur.com/u9sieKB.png ) in many different ways using sure thing expressions too like one from the wiki (/^.{2,20}$/) and i don't get it to work...  
09:17 <polx> has quit  
09:17 <vfzevaze> do i really have to add this (<input type="hidden" name="xvalidate" value="1" />) and if yes where?  
09:19 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <cjd> has quit  
09:59 <Denis> Enygma`: What's the status of the release ? you said on Tuesday to refrain committing, isn't it for 6.2M1 ?  
10:02 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <lucaa> has quit  
10:04 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:11 <Enygma`> Denis: the release is done. I`m announcing it today (1 hour)  
10:11 <Enygma`> you can safely start committing  
10:14 <Denis> ok, thanks  
10:31 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <vfzevaze> how ca i access the properties set in the configuration via config section (http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration+Application#HMakingyourapplicationeasilyconfigurablewithConfigurableClass28SinceEnterprise2.3M129)?  
10:42 <vfzevaze> in a groovy macro for example  
10:49 <cjd> vfzevaze: they are added to your configuration object in your config document  
10:50 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <vfzevaze> do you have an example? my macro is in another page the configuration page  
10:54 <cjd> http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/RegistrationConfig  
10:54 <cjd> http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Registration?viewer=code <-- and this is the code which uses it  
10:55 <cjd> beware the risks of text editors which highlight velocity :S   that made me write way more velocity than I should  
10:55 <vfzevaze> registrationconfig page -> You are not allowed to view this document or perform this action.  
10:56 <vfzevaze> but just found loadConfig('XWiki.RegistrationConfig')  
10:56 <vfzevaze> thanks again, i will try that  
10:58 <cjd> if you have a wiki, the same file should exist in it  
10:58 <vfzevaze> any groovy loadConfig example by the hand?  
10:59 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:59 <cjd> groovy and velocity are functionally equivilant, just remove the $ and replace   #set($xxx = ...) with  def xxx = ...;  
10:59 <rihbyne> has joined #xwiki  
11:00 <rihbyne> has quit  
11:00 <cjd> velocity is effectively java, just the #directives are added  
11:05 <sburjan> has quit  
11:07 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
11:08 <vfzevaze> well the loadConfig method is not working either with velocity (line is beeing printed out) or groovy (groovy.lang.MissingMethodException: No signature of method: org.codehaus.groovy.jsr223.GroovyScriptEngineImpl.loadConfig() is applicable for argument types: (java.lang.String) ) :/  
11:09 <cjd> loadConfig is something that's part of the registration page, it's not intrinsic to xwiki  
11:09 <cjd> you have to code it before you can call it :)  
11:09 <vfzevaze> oh i got it  
11:09 <vfzevaze> line 818  
11:09 <cjd> yeap  
11:10 <vfzevaze> dah!  
11:10 <vfzevaze> thx  
11:10 <cjd> sure thing  
11:10 <vfzevaze> i did tought it's included  
11:10 <vfzevaze> :P  
11:11 <cjd> anything beginning with a # is a velocity \*macro\*  
11:11 <gdelhumeau> We have remove XWikiPreferences from the subwiki xar. Consequence: we do not have any setting in subwiki by default...  
11:11 <cjd> which means it's specific to velocity  
11:11 <cjd> things beginning with a $ are variables, for example   $xcontext  is available in groovy, it's known as xcontext  
11:11 <vfzevaze> alright, good to know...  
11:11 <cjd> so velocity   $doc.getFullName()  corrisponds to groovy   doc.getFullName()  
11:12 <vfzevaze> ok  
11:28 <vmassol> has quit  
11:42 <polx> has quit  
11:44 <Enygma`1> has joined #xwiki  
11:45 <Enygma`> has quit  
11:48 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
11:55 <Slashman> has quit  
11:55 <vfzevaze> @cjd finally i got it: def customObject = xwiki.getDocument("Redmine-Macro.RedmineMacroConfiguration").getObject("Redmine-Macro.RedmineMacroConfigurationClass")  
11:56 <vfzevaze> and then accessing it through customObject.getProperty("redmineUrl").value  
11:56 <vfzevaze> yei  
11:56 <cjd> that looks right  
12:06 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:21 <polx> has quit  
13:05 <vfzevaze> @cjd: just added a small description  
13:05 <vfzevaze> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration+Application#HAccessingyourconfiguration  
13:09 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
13:30 <rihbyne> has joined #xwiki  
13:43 <gdelhumeau> about failing tests on the CI: we need a FlamingoSkinExecutor, as we have a ColibriSkinExecutor
